text: The black-headed grosbeak (Pheucticus melanocephalus) is a species of bird. It belongs in the family Cardinalidae. It is a medium-sized, seed-eating bird. It is 18â€“19 cm long. It weights 35-49 g. The black-headed grosbeak is a migratory bird. It has nesting grounds from southwestern British Columbia, through the western half of the United States, into central Mexico. It occurs as an introduced species further south in Central America. ==Other websites== * Pheucticus melanocephalus at The Cornell Lab of Ornithology Category:Passeri Category:Birds of North America
title: Black-headed grosbeak
